alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 11 at 6:26PM MST until August 11 at 7:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR WESTERN COCONINO COUNTY NEAR SUPAI... At 616 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms that produced heavy rain near and upstream of Supai. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing. The gauge at Supai indicated Havasu Creek cresting 5 feet above normal flow with over 1900 CFS at 5:30 pm MST. A flood wave will impact Havasu Creek, Mooney Falls, Havasu Falls, Beaver Falls, and the confluence at the Colorado River. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Grand Canyon National Park, Hualapai Hilltop, Havasupai Reservation and Supai. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Havasu Creek, Tapeats Creek, Royal Arch Creek, Deer Creek, Sowats Canyon, Shinumo Creek, Colorado River and Jumpup Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
